brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to discuss whether the parturients who underwent elective
      cesarean of such kind do not need prophylactic use of antibiotics and evaluate the risks and
      economic benefits involved.

clinical_study.brief_title: no Antibiotics for Elective Cesarean With Low Risk of Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial on Antibiotics Application For Low Infection-risked Elective Cesarean

other_outcome.description: Incision healing;Intrauterine infection;Pelvic and abdominal infection;Infection of urinary system

overall_official.affiliation: Obstetrics of 2nd Hospital of Shandong University

reference.citation: Committee opinion no. 465: antimicrobial prophylaxis for cesarean delivery: timing of administration. Obstet Gynecol. 2010 Sep;116(3):791-2. doi: 10.1097/AOG.0b013e3181f68086.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Postpartum hemorrhage volume estimates and Routine blood test.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
